bibl.title: In Re Application of Samuel O'Brien for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for Harry O'Brien. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington

div1.p: Territory of Washington } S.S. County of Spokane
In the matter of the application of Samuel O'Brien for a writ of Habeas Corpus for his infant son Harry O'Brien
To the Honorable George Turner associate Justice of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory

Your petitioner Samuel O'Brien respectfully represents and avows to your honor that he is the father of Harry OBrien an infant of the age of eight-years of age. That your petitioner lives at the city of Fremont in the state of Nebraska and is entitled to the care custody and control of said infant Harry O'Brien. That on or about the 2nd day of February AD 1888 during petitioners temporary absence from his house one Nancy OBrien took

said infant Harry OBrien from the home of petitioner and conveyed him to the Territory of Dakota where she secrited said child and from there she brought him to this Territory where she now secrited him and prevents your petitioner from having the care custody, or control of said infant. That your petitioner is informed and believes the said Nancy OBrien now has the said infant Harry OBrien secrited at or near Crescent Park in Lincoln County in this Territory and refuses to allow your petitioner to have the care custody and control of said infant Harry OBrien to which by law he is entitled. That your petitioner has reason to believe and does believe that the said

Nancy OBrien will take the said infant Harry OBrien out of the jurisdiction of the Courts of this Territory unless authority is given to the officer executing the writ in this matter, to take the said infant Harry OBrien into his custody and produce his body before your honor.

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus may be granted directed to the said Nancy OBrien commanding her to have the body of said infant Harry OBrien before your Honor at the time and place therein specified to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning said Harry OBrien; together with the time and cause of this detention. And that upon the hearing of said matter your honor will make an order restoring said infant to the care custody and control
of your petitioner. And for such other orders or relief as to your honor may seem right and lawful in the premises

Samuel OBrien
By Turner & Forster
His Attorneys
Territory of Washington } S.S. County of Spokane

Samuel OBrien being duly sworn deposes and says he is the person who makes the above and foregoing petition. That he has heard said petition, read and knows the contents thereof, and that the same is true to the best of his knowledge, information and belief,

Samuel OBrien.
Subscribed and sworn to before me the 9th of July 1887
W.W.D. Turner
Notary Public
